name: Mayflower Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mayflower Park hotel is centrally located and it's easy to explore downtown by foot.
reviews.title: Very good location, fair price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is in an older building and has a very nice interior. The rooms are kind of small, but nice and clean.
reviews.title: EXCEPTIONAL Service, Great Location, Clean and Elegant
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I live in Vancouver, BC and drove down to Seattle this past weekend, staying one night at Mayflower Park Hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! It was a fantastic experience. Aside from the great location in Downtown Seattle and our clean room, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Every single person went above and beyond, anticipating and attending to our every need. I would definitely recommend this hotel over and over again. We have already raved to our friends about their service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really felt your exceptional service made all the difference on our little weekend getaway.
reviews.title: A large room, a little old fashioned but overall a great location to stay in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, great location from the train and to sights. We were very pleased with eveything. The monring breakfast was delicious. We took the pre-cruise special that took us to the pier. If we went back to Seattle, we would not hestiate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Eight family members, four rooms. Depending on which room you get, you'll love it or be really disappointed. Me and hubby got the tiniest room I've ever stayed in with an even tinier bathroom. Wow, a larger person would have difficulty getting into the shower in this bathroom as the sink blocks the shower entry. The bed was pretty comfy and our room was very quiet.
reviews.title: Great depending on which type of room you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other three rooms my relative received were huge! Actually twice the size of our room with a full bath as well. The only thing is all bathrooms have a glass over the back of the sink which makes it challenging to wash your face without hitting your forehead on the glass. Strange.
reviews.title: Historic hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a doorman at both street entrances and they are very friendly and helpful. The front desk staff were helpful and pleasant. The lobby is lovely, we especially enjoyed the mezzanine lobby area which was like we were sitting in a living room. I tend to go for boutique type hotels and this one did not dissapoint even though our room was tiny.
reviews.title: Great location !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We all agreed that we enjoyed our stay in this lovely hotel. The Mall being "attached" to the hotel made going back and forth so easy. We also enjoyed our breakfast at Andaluca.
reviews.title: A Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: A home away from Home!
Wonderful Hotel....great location
reviews.text: The Mayflower Park is a great hotel with an attentive and friendly staff, We booked this hotel as a recomendation from a friend and so glad we changed our reservations. I liked the small, personal feel of the property as well as it being a historical hotel - it has so much mnore character and history than many chain hotels. It is close to everything: we walked everywhere! Did take the monorail (1 block away) to Seattle Center - but walked back. Oliver's, the bar in the hotel, was very comfortable and makes great drinks. We stayed in a suite and it was just perfect for our family. The beds were super comfortable and although the rooms are small, having the extra living room and bathroom made our stay exceptional. The only cons I can think of is that the rooms are small (but cozy), no refrigerator in room and the fitness room is super small, however none of this effected our visit nor changed the positive review of the hotel, but others may like to know this. Can not wait to return !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay here at the Mayflower Park. We were upgraded to a suite for our anniversary. The manager also sent a small box of candy and card to the room later that evening. Very nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite roomy, 10th floor and a view. Great bed and quiet. We arrived about noon and were going to store luggage until the room was ready BUT it was ready.
reviews.title: We lucked out with Hotwire.ca

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Unfortunately the restaurant was being renovated. They had a small continental breakfast set up in the lounge. That was okay but not worth the $12.00 each they charged us since it was really not any nicer than a free Holiday Inn Express breakfast.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The waiters were great and very apologetic. They even used only paper products since they didn't have a dishwasher. We would have ventured out for breakfast but it was pouring.
reviews.title: terrific location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I grabbed this good deal on Hotwire for about $80 per night. Of course, being right in the city, we had to pay for valet parking through the hotel for $20 per night. But this still was cheaper than most hotels in the area. This hotel was by far the fanciest accommodations we stayed in on our trip to Washington State, and a great way to end our vacation.
reviews.title: Got a heck of a deal on Hotwire--beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Since we left the car with the valets (and didn’t want to pay for parking around the city), we simply walked everywhere around town. Pike Place Market is just four blocks from the hotel, and the waterfront is just a few blocks past that. We walked over to the Seattle Center (10 blocks), but have to admit that we rode the monorail back. It stops right in the mall that connects to the back of the hotel--very convenient!! We also walked to Pioneer Square (13 blocks) and even walked to the REI flagship store (13 blocks).
reviews.title: Free upgrade to king suite
Beautiful Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed on the 8th floor, looking towards 5th Street. Our room with a king-sized bed was super comfy and everything was extremely clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here 2 nights before the business part of my trip would start. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I had booked a regular room but at check-in I was informed that I had been upgraded to a king suite which was great. The location of the hotel was great, across the street from Macy's, and perfect for exploring Seattle on foot.
reviews.title: Very nice downtown hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room itself was big, with a separate sitting room. The bathroom was a little small in comparison. Shower was great. The decor of the room was supposed to be European style but the flowery motive was a little bit overdone.
reviews.title: Great location and wonderful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in town for a family wedding on Memorial Weekend. We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Two women traveling together could not ask for a better room. Our room had two beds and two bathrooms. The beds are so comfortable you could get spoiled. Great view from our 8th floor room. The room is not that large but for the amount of time we spent in the room it was perfect for us. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go downtown. Bring your walking shoes.
reviews.title: Great Historic Hotel

likes.liked: — Everything in the area was within walking distance if you like to walk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the space needle, pike's market, numerous restaurants, and did lots of shopping.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent - this will be our first choice next time!

likes.liked: — Quality of the hotel and room. Also it's excellent location.
likes.disliked: — You could hear voices in the next room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even if you don't have dinner in the hotel restaurant I would recommend dessert.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is like being in Mecca if you're idea of Nirvana is shopping. It is very easy to locate in Seattle. The car valets were helpful and courteous. The front desk staff were prompt. And the concierge, well, he was the absolute best we have ever had. He had suggestions for shows, attractions, timelines, and restaurants. He even made suggestions for what to order off the menus!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!

likes.liked: — location to shopping, downtown area, clubs, & bars.

reviews.title: Fantastic First Impression of Seattle
reviews.text: The room we had was a standard with a small queen. It was a corner room with 2 windows that opened to let in fresh air (yes, you need fresh air even in frigid February). It was a little stuffy without the windows being left open. I would say spend a little extra money and get a deluxe room with a king.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bathroom was also very small and not big enough for 2 people sharing! Definitely need either 2 bathrooms (as some of the more deluxe rooms have), or ask for one with a larger bathroom.
reviews.title: A Gem in the Emerald City

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of the rooms, and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we didn't spend hardly any time in the hotel as we were out and about so much.
reviews.title: As a local, I have a totally different perception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was ideal. One block from either direction of both Macy's and Nordstrom's (and about 6 Starbuck's coffee bars in a 4 block radius). Plus, just 5 minute walks from other name-brand chains. And close to Pike Place market and great venues like the Triple Door, and fantastic restaurants. Too many restaurants to choose from. All that means is that we will need to go back and try them all out. And we will definitely be staying at the Mayflower Park Hotel; plan to make it 'our hotel' whenever we go to Seattle.
reviews.title: Event Staff is beyond compare, beautiful rooms
A very nice stay
reviews.text: Mayflower Park Hotel is a great choice if you want something equidistant between the Space Needle and the basball/football arenas, as I did.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The needle is definitely walkable.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel, friendly staff and close to everything

likes.liked: — Spacious room with fine amenities, friendly staff, super bed/bedding
likes.disliked: — two small elevators, but actually no problem, just minor wait for your turn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The stadiums are too, but are much longer.
reviews.title: Great Location and Reasonable Rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Definitely leave 30-40 minutes for that walk.
reviews.title: Historic downtown hotel with a good location

likes.disliked: — Beds were very firm and wobbled a lot.

reviews.title: Charming classic hotel in good location
reviews.text: Another thing that's very close is Pike Place Market. It's only a few blocks away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you want a hotel with a big Lobby packed with guests lounging around waiting for their Convention buddies so they can go to a noisy hotel bar, then the Mayflower is not the place you will want to stay.
reviews.title: A European Styled Hotel in Downtown Seattle

likes.liked: — A boutique hotel with charm in a central, downtown location in Seattle
likes.disliked: — The Seattle Street system makes it easy to miss the front entrance the first time you visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Mayflower is one of those small historic hotels that if you were in London you would be writing home about. Cozy, charming and right downtown near all the stores including Nordstroms across the street. Yes, the bathrooms are on the small side but done in a very nice black & white tile.
reviews.title: wonderful location

likes.disliked: — late check in, expensive to park car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Oliver's is the bar in the hotel and they are know for their martinis and the hotel breakfast at Andaluca is very good.
reviews.title: Noise issues for some rooms
Enjoyed Mayflower Park
reviews.text: If you are bringing your car, let me suggest you valet park it and then walk around downtown or take a cab, as it less expensive to do that than pay $12 for a 2-hour parking lot near Pike Place Market or a similar amount down near the waterfront. By the way, you won't be fighting a tour bus when you arrive, as it is a hotel made for people not conventioneers running up and down the hallway at 2am.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Not cheap...but I have found not much is among the better hotels in Seattle these days.
reviews.title: Underwhelming but not a bad choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Mayflower with a family group in town for a wedding. In all we had 6 rooms, 3 generations.
reviews.title: Great location, Superior staff, Good hotel, lousy elevators

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located and is a very nice small hotel. The rooms and the lobby appear to have been renovated fairly recently. The lobby is small but nicely appionted. The restaurant is very nice - reasonably priced with well above average food.
reviews.title: High expectations met

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: My wife and I requested a deluxe queen. The hotel only advertised that they had 3 types of rooms - Standard queen, Deluxe queen (larger) and Double queen. Upon arrival were were put into a King room (the clerk explained that they only have about a half dozen king rooms) Our room was very large - could have accomodated another King with adaquate walking room remaining. The double queen rooms appeared somewhat more cramped, with limited space next to the beds.
reviews.title: Awesome independent hotel centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As is common in older hotels, electric outlets is a bit of a challenge. No extra power near the bed, and we had to rotate power supplies to keep a laptop, cell phone and blackberry's all charged. One significant negative is the very VERY small bathrooms. A tub, sink and camode with room to stand is all you get. Nice shampoo and conditioner in large wall mounted pump bottles in the shower, a bar of soap and towels. No extras. My mother in law complained that there was nowhere to hang a towel - the only towel bar is in over the bathtub.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only other significant complaint is that the 2 very small elevators are inadaquate to service the 10 floor hotel. 4 - 5 minute waiting times were normal during peak hours. Each elevator can handle only 6 people at a time so arriving at the lobby to find 10 people waiting (happened more than once in our week long stay) resulted in an unacceptable wait.
reviews.title: Great location, an ageless treasure

description: Ideally located in thriving downtown Seattle, the Historic Mayflower Park Hotel is in the heart of the city. Built in 1927, the classic Mayflower Park Hotel has been lovingly restored with crystal chandeliers, gleaming brass and period antiques that offer an inviting European elegance to this historic Seattle hotel. The hotel is ideally located steps away from Seattle’s most exciting attractions, including the famous Pike Place Market, Seattle Waterfront, and Space Needle. A full array of museums, theaters, shops and restaurants are at our doorstep while Washington State Convention and Trade Center is only 4 short blocks away. The hotel opens directly into Westlake Center, with 80 specialty shops and direct access to the Monorail, which means you are just a 2 minute ride away from the Space Needle, Seattle Center and Experience Music Project.
